body: @kchibisov I'm not sure what you want to ask but from what I can infer, the 0.11.0 release works fine without any major error (there is this `Xlib:sequence lost (0x10087 > 0x89) in reply type 0x0!` error but it hasn't affected me so far)
@kchibisov wait wdym? I dont know much about git and github (at least not yet) so please explain to me what you mean and show me how to do it
I mean if you've cloned the repo, you can `git checkout 578e084` in it and do a `cargo run --release` from it. I'd assume you've built a git version somehow.

@kchibisov Yes I have built a git version but I just copied and paste the commands so I don't know much more than how to build the software. Anyways, I have school now so I'll test it when I get home and tell you about the result
@kchibisov Sorry for the slow update but the commit you mentioned seem to work fine

We've investigated with @chrisduerr the issue and it's pretty trivial to fix it (could just ignore the swap buffers error). Though, I wonder what will be the right fix for this issue.

I have a suspicion that the window is unmapped and we shouldn't draw into the unmapped window. For that winit integration must be established somehow, so we can get the state of map/unmapped window.

issue.title: Ignore errors from swap_buffers
issue.body:
Most of them are innocent and require just swap again. It was like that before anyway due to old glutin bug in the error handling implementation where errors won't pulled on swap buffers, but old observed error was used.

Fixes #6538.
